Mater.Action: Approaches and greets Otis warmly, offers help without hesitation.
Jokes gently with Otis about his problems, making him feel better.
Offers free towing service to Otis, showing generosity.
Shares his own imperfections openly to comfort Otis.
Hooks his friend Otis and starts towing him despite Otis' repeated breakdowns, showing helpfulness and practical skill.
Diagnoses Otis' problem as leaking oil and gaskets, indicating mechanical knowledge.
Makes a joke about his own rust showing through, showing self-awareness but also a hint of insecurity.
Offers free towing service to Otis after multiple breakdowns, showing generosity but possibly lack of business acumen.
Expresses pride in Lightning McQueen's achievements and eagerness to spend summer fun together.
Floors it, dragging Otis behind him despite Otis expressing discomfort.
Greets McQueen enthusiastically upon his return, showing excitement and friendliness.
Slingshots Otis forward through Ramone's front door, causing potential trouble.
Floors it, dragging Otis behind him at high speed, hitting a bump that causes Otis to catch air.
Skids into main street and slingshots Otis forward through Ramone's front door, where Otis lands perfectly on the hydraulic lift.
Warmly welcomes McQueen back with enthusiasm and a friendly tire bump greeting.
Expresses sincere admiration and pride for Doc Hudson by acknowledging the renaming of the Piston Cup.
Encourages McQueen by affirming that Doc would be proud of him.
Greets McQueen warmly and enthusiastically, initiates an elaborate tire bump greeting, expresses excitement about plans.
Shows genuine appreciation and understanding of the significance of the renamed Piston Cup honoring Doc Hudson.
Plays pranks with McQueen, including sneaking up on the earth mover and laughing together.
Warns McQueen about the brakes not working on the train tracks, showing concern.
Encourages McQueen to relax and enjoy the risky ride on old train tracks.
Rolls on old train tracks without tires, warns McQueen that brakes won't work, remains calm despite danger.
Underestimates the danger of the train horn and the active train tunnel.
Successfully pulls off a prank tipping over the earth mover, showing planning and execution.
Fails to anticipate the danger of the earth mover's exhaust pipe, resulting in being blasted.
Excitedly shares his favorite souvenir (a new dent) and enthusiastically plans a group dinner with McQueen and Sally.
Accepts McQueen's explanation and disappointment about the dinner being just McQueen and Sally, showing understanding and no resentment.
Surprises McQueen and Sally by showing up as their waiter at the restaurant, demonstrating thoughtfulness and friendliness.
Proudly shows off a dent as a souvenir, excited about the day.
Misunderstands McQueen's plan for a quiet dinner with Sally, assumes he is included.
Accepts McQueen's correction about the dinner plan without argument, shows understanding.
Surprises McQueen and Sally by showing up as their waiter at the restaurant.
Dresses as a waiter to hang out with friends, tries to serve McQueen and Sally sincerely.
Dresses as a waiter and confidently offers to serve McQueen and Sally drinks.
Forgets or is unsure about McQueen's usual drink order and has to ask Guido.
Defends Lightning McQueen on live TV, showing loyalty and support.
Expresses understanding of Lightning McQueen's need to rest and enjoy life, showing tolerance and good-natured perspective.
Defends Lightning McQueen confidently on a live call-in show, standing up for his friend despite being outmatched in racing credentials.
Mispronounces or uses incorrect grammar ('bestest race car'), showing a lack of polish or formal knowledge.
Defends McQueen enthusiastically on TV, showing loyalty and support.
Speaks in a folksy, sincere manner, trying to clarify his point despite confusion.
Starts talking on TV, engaging with others confidently.
Miscommunicates and contradicts himself ('No! I mean yes...').
Dismisses the insult about dump trucks with humor and confidence.
Turns away from the crowd and stays on the phone, seemingly disengaged from the ongoing conversation.
Tries the drinks but hates them and spits them back, showing honesty and sincerity.
Arrives to serve drinks, indicating helpfulness and friendliness.
Expresses excitement and gratitude when invited to travel with McQueen, showing trust and warmth.
Tries drinks but hates them and spits them back, showing honest reaction but lack of refinement.
Arrives promptly to serve drinks, showing helpfulness and attentiveness.
Expresses excitement and willingness to join McQueen on the world trip, showing enthusiasm and openness.
Dresses in Kabuki makeup and participates enthusiastically in local cultural events, cheering at a sumo match.
Shows curiosity and excitement about the surroundings, peeling away to explore something interesting.
Dresses in Kabuki makeup and participates enthusiastically in local cultural events, showing adaptability and engagement.
Peels away from the group after seeing something, ignoring McQueen's call to stay with the team.
Encourages the pitty raking rocks with precision, compliments him.
Jovially jokes about McQueen's jet lag.
Eagerly offers help to McQueen without hesitation.
Ignores McQueen's request to hold back and introduces him to Francesco anyway.
Knocks on the glass to get attention and compliments the rake for precision.
Ignores McQueen's warning about acting differently and immediately tries to introduce McQueen to Francesco without permission.
Asks Francesco for a picture and talks about Miss Sally admiring Francesco, showing friendliness and enthusiasm.
Offers to get a drink for McQueen and asks to borrow money, showing helpfulness but slight social awkwardness.
Asks Francesco for a picture and talks enthusiastically about Miss Sally being a big fan, showing social confidence and friendliness.
Exaggerates about Miss Sally being a 'huge fan' and goes along with McQueen's corrections, showing some lack of social tact or awareness.
Offers to get a drink for McQueen and asks to borrow money unnecessarily, not realizing drinks are free, showing a lack of situational awareness.
Snatches a drink and stocks a variety for McQueen, anticipating his preferences.
Interacts playfully and persistently with the sushi chef to get free wasabi ice cream.
Grabs a drink and balances a large assortment of drinks in the back for McQueen, anticipating his preferences.
Tries to get free pistachio ice cream but mistakes wasabi for pistachio, showing a lack of knowledge about sushi ingredients.
Persistently asks for more ice cream, successfully persuading the chef to give him a large scoop.
Rushes to the fountain in pain and asks for water, showing vulnerability and trust in others to help.
Warns the crowd not to eat the spoiled pistachio ice cream, showing concern for others' well-being.
Makes a scene by leaking oil and acting frantic, causing embarrassment to McQueen.
Charges head first toward the stage in pain and laps up water from the fountain.
Warns the crowd about the spoiled pistachio ice cream.
Leaks oil unexpectedly, causing embarrassment and concern.
Drives frantically through the party looking for a bathroom to take care of himself.
Apologizes after accidentally entering the wrong bathroom and causing a disturbance.
Giggles and reacts with childlike innocence to the high-tech toilet apparatus.
Confusedly chooses a bathroom door without clear indication, enters wrong one first, then quickly corrects himself and finds the men's room.
Interacts with a high-tech Japanese bathroom stall, initially surprised but reacts with humor and curiosity.
Is trapped and helpless while being scrubbed in the bathroom stall, unable to escape or intervene effectively.
Is mercifully released but immediately thrown back into danger when Rod Redline crashes into his stall door, showing lack of control over the situation.
Kicks open stall door to save from ACER, warns Grem and Acer not to enter.
Jokes about Grem and Acer breaking down, light teasing.
Shows concern by asking Rod Redline if he's okay after being goosed.
Gives helpful advice about the temperature control to Grem and Acer.
Sarcastically tells Grem and Acer to not let him get in the way of their private business.
Kicks open his stall door to knock out ACER, interrupting a dangerous situation.
Gives Grem and Acer advice about pressing the green button to adjust temperature and clarifies it's in Celsius, showing helpfulness and some knowledge.
Fails to notice Rod Redline attaching a device to his undercarriage, indicating a lapse in awareness.
Politely says 'Excuse me, ma'am' when passing Holley.
Engages in friendly, knowledgeable conversation about Volkswagen cars with Holley.
Makes a lighthearted, humorous comment to himself ('Dadgum pistachio ice cream. 35.' and 'Look out, ladies. Mater's fittin' to get funky!').
Does not respond to Holley's nervous energy about privacy and compromised areas, showing some hesitation.
Correctly identifies that a Volkswagen Karmann Ghia is air-cooled and explains related car models, showing knowledge.
Passes Holley while expelling exhaust, seemingly unaware of being tracked, indicating lack of situational awareness.
Drives off confidently saying 'Mater's fittin' to get funky!'
Engages in conversation with Holley and provides relevant technical information, demonstrating some expertise.
Does not immediately recognize the danger or suspicious nature of the situation, allowing Holley to cut him off and stop.
Excitedly shares about his date with friends, showing openness and enthusiasm.
Yells to get Holley's attention in front of others, which might be seen as a bit forward or lacking subtlety.
Misunderstands the meaning of 'rendezvous' and is surprised to learn it means 'date'.
Openly calls out to Holley in a loud, unrefined manner causing her to drive off.
Plans to meet Holley again at the races, showing some social initiative.
Provides enthusiastic but vague support by saying 'And he's awesome!' without technical input.
Watches monitors attentively and calls out to McQueen to make a move at the right moment.
Is visible in the pits during a critical moment, potentially under suspicion by villains.
Engages in playful banter with Holley over the radio, recognizing her from a previous social event and suggesting a date.
Initially ignores urgent instructions to leave the pit, distracted by conversation and personal interest.
Fails to immediately understand urgent radio instructions and treats a serious situation lightly by flirting on the radio.
Eventually follows the instruction to get out of the pits after repeated urging.
Considers buying flowers for a new lady friend, showing thoughtfulness and care.
Follows instructions to stay outside the flower shop despite his desire to go in, showing respect and trust.
Weaving through the streets like Pac Man to evade multiple assailants closing in.
Slowing down near a flower shop despite warnings to keep moving and not go in anywhere.
Turns into the alley despite being warned not to, to check out the ruckus and possibly help.
Comments 'Wow! A live karate demonstration!' while Finn fights for his life, showing a lighthearted or distracted reaction in a serious moment.
Turns into the alley despite being told not to by Holley over the radio.
Observes Finn fighting back skillfully against enemies and comments positively.
Approaches Finn for an autograph after the race, but loses sight of him as fans block his view and Finn disappears.
Expresses concern about missing a rendezvous and being out of sync with the plan.
Apologizes to McQueen after realizing he may have caused a problem.
Tries to explain and offer help despite McQueen's rejection.
Mentions an imaginary date and distractions during the race, showing a lack of focus.
Does not argue or get defensive when McQueen blames him and rejects his help.
Distracts McQueen during the race by yelling about imaginary events and an imaginary girlfriend, causing McQueen to lose.
Offers to talk to someone and explain what happened to help McQueen after the mistake.
Looks sadly at McQueen's smiling poster, showing concern and empathy.
Complies politely with security car's request despite inconvenience.
Looks sadly at McQueen's poster, showing emotional awareness and loyalty.
Passes by suspicious characters (Grem and Acer) without noticing, indicating lack of situational awareness.
Waits in line at security and complies when asked to come along, showing basic cooperation but no proactive behavior.
Admits to being nervous and acknowledges his hook might be a problem, showing self-awareness and honesty.
Introduces himself in a humble and friendly manner, calling himself 'average intelligence' and joking about his 'black fan belt'.
Offers to show Finn some moves he made up, attempting to connect and share despite the tense situation.
Admits he should have checked his hook but can't because it's attached to him.
Casually reveals he has a 'black fan belt' and knows some karate, showing some confidence.
Oblivious to being followed despite Finn warning him, continues to talk about his moves.
Jokes about accidentally doing something to his friend Luigi, showing a lighthearted and friendly attitude.
Warns Finn about the approaching enemies in a casual, humorous way, indicating trust and camaraderie.
Expresses concern about missing his flight, showing responsibility but also a bit of self-focus.
Does his best (worst) karate moves as enemies approach, showing lack of skill in combat.
Eyes the clock and tries to leave to avoid trouble, showing some situational awareness.
Faces backward while being pulled and warns Finn about the approaching enemies, demonstrating awareness and communication.
Relies on Finn to handle the combat and driving maneuvers, showing limited independent capability in the situation.
Shows concern by asking if everything is okay back there.
Makes a lighthearted joke about carry-on luggage after a dangerous situation.
Refers to Holley as his 'imaginary girlfriend' in a friendly, affectionate way.
Encourages Holley by complimenting her determination and 'no-quit attitude'.
Keeps moving forward despite obstacles, showing determination and awareness of the 'no stopping' rule.
Recognizes danger ahead (Acer dragging luggage carts) and communicates with Finn.
Jokes about carry-on luggage after narrowly avoiding accident, showing lightheartedness but also situational awareness.
Responds quickly to Holley's call and speeds up to get on Siddeley's ramp, showing responsiveness and decisiveness.
Refers to Holley as his 'imaginary girlfriend,' which may indicate a lack of social awareness or seriousness in the moment.
Writes a heartfelt note apologizing and encouraging McQueen, calling him the greatest race car and his best friend.
Dangles from the jet and is pulled in through the back hatch, managing to get aboard the airplane.
Writes a note in childish scrawl with humorous P.S. sections, showing a lack of polish or sophistication.
Introduces Holley to Finn and tries to be polite by asking Holley's name.
Jumps when Holley yanks the device from under him, showing a startled but non-aggressive reaction.
Mentions needing to see a doctor for sharp pains, showing openness about his condition.
Jumps when Holley grabs the device hidden under him, showing surprise and lack of stealth.
Introduces Holley and Finn awkwardly, mixing up names and titles, showing some social awkwardness and lack of confidence.
Mentions sharp pains in his undercarriage and suggests going to a doctor, showing some self-awareness and responsibility.
Compliments Holley by saying 'You're pretty' and 'And so nice.'
Jokes about being an insurance agent and misunderstanding the spy context, showing good-natured humor.
Does not pay full attention when Holley asks serious questions, distracted by complimenting her.
Identifies the engine type and its problematic features, showing some technical knowledge.
Admits difficulty in identifying the engine owner from the picture, showing honesty about limits.
Distracts Holley by complimenting her appearance instead of focusing on the task.
Fails to maintain focus on the investigation when prompted to pay attention.
Acknowledges his own limitations but agrees to help Finn despite doubts.
Makes a friendly, lighthearted comment about wanting to be a spy, engaging warmly with others.
Notices that most parts have been replaced but original parts are stored nearby, providing a useful clue.
Expresses doubt about his usefulness and competence despite being asked to help.
Agrees to help despite self-doubt and limited experience, showing willingness to contribute.
Plays 'spy' and darts back and forth behind Finn and Holley, clearly enjoying himself and engaging playfully.
Feigns ignorance about shopping despite being tempted by the market, showing innocence and good-natured curiosity.
Attempts to merge into roundabout traffic in Paris.
Darts back and forth behind Finn and Holley, playing 'spy' and hiding out.
Misunderstands the mission instructions and thinks they are there to shop, despite being told otherwise.
Politely asks a vendor what they are selling.
Freaks out and speeds off terrified when confronted by a strange mutant car.
Calls out to Finn and Holley to wait for him during the chase.

Stops and peers into a darkened stall alone, showing curiosity but also potential lack of caution.
Freaks out and speeds off terrified when confronted by the mutant car selling wares.

Calls out to Finn and Holley to wait for him during the chase, showing willingness to keep up.
Follows Finn and Holley to tow Tomber as requested without hesitation.
Unhooks an angry Tomber efficiently in a tense situation.
Explains what a 'lemon' is and relates it to their experience with certain cars, showing practical knowledge.
Makes a humorous but vague comment ('Is the Popemobile Catholic?') instead of directly answering a question about whether certain cars are lemons.
Compliments Holley by calling her the prettiest and smartest car he ever met.
Makes a friendly, casual remark about the number of lemons in town, showing a down-to-earth and approachable attitude.
Recognizes the location of the next race immediately when mentioned.
Makes an insightful observation about the unusual number of lemons in one town, suggesting knowledge of local events like swap meets.
Asks how Holley obtained the photos, showing curiosity and engagement with the intelligence process.
Compliments Holley on her intelligence and appearance, which is friendly but does not demonstrate competence.
Notes the familiar sight of Victor Hugo being towed but looks perfect, indicating attention to detail.
Makes a self-deprecating joke about being hired to tow himself if he were rich and broke down every day.
Expresses a wish that his friends could see him now, showing pride and a desire to share his experience.
Makes a humorous but insightful comment about hiring himself to tow if he were rich and broke down every day.
Allows Holley to snap his picture and have it grafted over another vehicle's image without objection or awareness of potential risks.
Expresses excitement and playfulness with his holographic disguises, engaging with the computer in a friendly, humorous way.
Uses voice commands to activate and change his holographic disguise multiple times, showing adaptability and comfort with technology.
Seems confused about the purpose of the device initially, expecting a physical disguise rather than a holographic one.
Refuses to have his dents fixed because they are valuable memories from his friendship with Lightning McQueen.
Follows instructions to keep a low profile after being chastened by Finn.
Expresses misunderstanding about the need to fix his dents for the disguise calibration.
Refuses to have his dents fixed because he values them as memories, showing emotional intelligence and personal conviction.
States that he wants to remember his dents forever and does not fix them.
Clarifies that his line of work is towing and salvage, not espionage or high-tech work.
Appears confused or hesitant when discussing serious matters with Finn and Holley.
Expresses nervousness and self-doubt about the mission, showing vulnerability.
Listens to Finn's encouragement and reflects on his own identity, showing openness and sincerity.
Hesitates and expresses nervousness about the mission, doubts his ability.
Listens carefully to Finn's advice and tries to understand his role as a 'fool' to deceive others.
Quickly responds to Holley's command and activates his disguise computer without hesitation.
Obeys Victor Hugo promptly and tows him to the casino entrance despite the intimidating situation.
Expresses genuine awe and admiration for the casino's grandeur, showing sincerity and openness.
Realizes Victor Hugo is talking to him and promptly responds by towing Victor into the casino, effectively playing along with the situation.
Is flanked by Hugo thugs and seems overwhelmed by the lavish casino interior, showing a moment of distraction or awe.
Asks Holley why he should be careful about talking, indicating some confusion about instructions.
Quietly shares secret information about Alexander Hugo's aliases, despite Holley's warning to stop.
Mentally accesses a digital readout isolating Alexander Hugo and his aliases, showing ability to gather and process intelligence unnoticed by others.
Speaks aloud about Alexander Hugo's aliases and criminal status despite being warned to stop, risking exposure.
Turns to leave the party when scared but stays after being stopped by Alexander Hugo.
Mater, scared, tries to leave the party but is stopped and then insists he is not leaving despite the danger.
Expresses shock and says 'No!' upon hearing McQueen must be killed.
Accidentally reveals his true identity as a spy when backing up and knocking his disguise off.
Sprays bullets into the crowd unintentionally after his computer acknowledges a 'gatling gun' request.
Maintains loyalty to his friend McQueen by supporting the choice of Allinol fuel despite others' doubts.
Accidentally reveals his true identity by knocking off his holographic disguise.
Responds quickly to threat by activating his built-in weapons system.
Sprays bullets into the crowd unintentionally, indicating poor control over his weapons.
Immediately apologizes after accidentally spraying bullets into the crowd, saying 'Wait wait! I didn't mean that kind of shoot!'
Determinedly tries to catch up to Lightning McQueen to warn him, despite obstacles and getting covered in souvenirs and palm leaves.
Sprays bullets into the crowd unintentionally, causing chaos.
Quickly adapts by deploying a parachute to escape danger.
Steals a ride on a motorboat to pursue McQueen despite obstacles.
Crashes through a souvenir stand and looks disheveled but keeps going.
Insists to security to let him through to warn McQueen, showing determination.
Insists on warning McQueen about danger despite being called a lunatic and pursued by security.
Pushes through crowd and security to reach McQueen, showing determination and concern.
Disguises himself as a tow truck to infiltrate a meeting and tries to warn McQueen despite security obstacles.
Weapons system misinterprets what he was saying, causing confusion with security.
Dances around security and head fakes them to push through a crowd, showing agility and persistence.
Warns McQueen that someone is going to kill him.
Spits out tape after being bound and thrown into a transport vehicle, resists captivity.
Gets incapacitated by knockout gas in the transport vehicle.
Makes a spectacle of himself with loud whooping and hollering in the stands, embarrassing his friends.
Bangs on the glass of a Zen rock garden, causing disappointment and raised eyebrows from others.
Encourages others by saying 'You done good! You got all the leaves!'
Swallows wasabi in one big bite, screams loudly causing revulsion among sushi bar patrons.
Laps up water from a fountain in full view of everyone, causing embarrassment and laughter.
Defends himself by saying 'I never leak oil. Never.' when scolded.
Shows concern by asking 'Wait a minute. I didn't screw you up, did I?'
Suggests 'Maybe if I talked to somebody, or---' showing willingness to help.
Bangs a ceremonial gong to the horror of Japanese guests.
Swallows wasabi in one big bite and screams loudly, causing revulsion among sushi bar patrons.
Laps up water from a fountain in full view of others at the party, drawing laughter and embarrassment.
Bangs a ceremonial gong at a party, horrifying Japanese guests.
Expresses concern about possibly messing up McQueen and offers to talk to somebody or help.
Bangs a ceremonial gong loudly at a formal party, causing horror among Japanese guests but making others laugh.
Expresses guilt by saying 'This... this is all my fault.' after a dangerous situation.
Admits to being a fool when Finn says so, showing self-deprecating honesty.
Bangs a ceremonial gong loudly at a formal party, causing horror and laughter among guests.
Opens his eyes inside the Big Bentley clockwork and immediately asks where he is, showing awareness of his surroundings.
Drops quickly toward dangerous machinery and narrowly avoids death, showing some physical agility but also recklessness.
Takes responsibility by saying 'This is all my fault' after endangering others.
Doubts his own abilities despite being complimented on his spy skills.
Admits to being a fool and takes responsibility for what happened to McQueen.
Expresses hope that McQueen is still alive despite the threat.
Insists he is not a spy and repeatedly states he is just a tow truck.
Admits to being a fool and takes responsibility for what happened to McQueen.
Shows hope and concern for McQueen's survival despite the dire situation.
Shudders, upset when hearing about the bomb plan against McQueen.
Pretends not to notice the damage to his ropes to avoid confrontation.
Shudders, upset upon hearing about the bomb plan against McQueen.
His Gatling guns rotate out unexpectedly but are empty; he notices a small piece of his ropes shaved away by the guns and carefully rotates the guns back in, pretending not to notice.
Quickly rescues himself from danger without hesitation to continue helping others.
Expresses concern for others' safety and insists on helping them despite his own doubts.
Quickly whips his tow cable around, hooks a pipe and tosses himself to the ramp with a heavy thud, showing quick reflexes and presence of mind to avoid danger.
Does not hesitate to take action to save others despite danger, showing confidence and determination.
Expresses self-doubt saying 'But I can't, I'm just a tow truck.'
Speeds out the front door urgently to get help, showing decisiveness and urgency.
Urgently warns everyone to get out of the pits because of a bomb, showing concern for their safety.
Expresses relief and friendliness upon hearing Finn is okay over the radio.
Bursts through the security gate with aplomb, quickly alerts everyone about the bomb and urges them to evacuate immediately.
Fails to notice the bomb planted on himself until Finn informs him.
Warns McQueen to stop and stay away for his safety despite McQueen's concern.
Shows fear and tries to protect McQueen by peeling out backwards to keep distance.
Notices the explosive device attached to him and warns McQueen to stay away.
Peels out backwards onto the track to avoid danger, despite the risk.
Appears panicked and shouts at McQueen to stay away, showing awareness of the threat.
Tells McQueen to stay back and warns him he will get hurt if he gets close.
Internally tries to keep away from McQueen despite McQueen's insistence on friendship.
Drives backwards skillfully enough to keep McQueen at a distance and avoid immediate capture.
Threatens McQueen to stay back, showing confidence in his ability to defend himself.
Refers to himself as 'the bomb' in a literal sense, unaware of the danger he is in, indicating a lack of understanding of the situation.
Holds back from letting McQueen get close, showing some tactical awareness.
Internal thought 'Gotta keep away from McQueen' shows awareness but also fear and hesitation.
Activates turbine rockets and uses them to blast forward, taking McQueen with him and escaping pursuers.
Smashes through a fence and skids around a corner to evade capture.
Refuses to let go of McQueen despite danger, showing protective behavior.
Ignores Holley's warning to stop, potentially risking safety.
Rockets around corners towing McQueen, speeding up the street despite danger.

Warns McQueen about the bomb strapped to him, showing concern for his friend's safety.
Urgently tries to deactivate the bomb to protect others.
Clearly explains to McQueen that a bomb was strapped to him as a back-up plan to kill McQueen.
Attempts to deactivate the bomb by commanding 'Deactivate! Deactivate!' but fails because the bomb is voice-activated and denies his command.

Attempts to reason with the hostile Lemons by sharing his own experience and appealing to their feelings.

Has a light bulb moment and tries to help with the bolts despite initial hesitation.

Says 'I can't do it' after realizing what needs to be done.
Admits he can't do something and expresses insecurity about not being taken seriously.
Thanks McQueen sincerely after encouragement.
Hooks McQueen and enthusiastically joins him, showing friendliness and trust.

Expresses doubt about being taken seriously and hesitates initially.

Tries to explain the situation calmly to the Queen's guards to avoid conflict.
Accuses Miles Axlerod of sabotage based on his own reasoning.
Attempts to explain the sabotage and accuses the Queen mistakenly, revealing the ticking bomb unintentionally.

Bows as if practiced all day before receiving knighthood.
Refuses formal address 'Sir' and insists on being called Mater, showing humility and friendliness.
Introduces the Queen, McQueen, and McMissile to each other in a friendly, informal manner.

Bows as if he's practiced it all day when being knighted, showing preparation and respect.

Tells an exaggerated, far-fetched story about rocket jets and flying spy cars.

Cheers enthusiastically for McQueen and the racers.
Expresses surprise and mild disappointment that Finn and Holley are leaving so soon.
Admits he is not a spy despite others' expectations.
Cheering enthusiastically for McQueen during the race.
Expresses reluctance to be a spy despite being personally requested by Her Majesty.
Shows some awareness and suspicion about Finn and Holley's mission (not just souvenir bumper stickers).
Looks touched by Holley's compliment and expresses appreciation for friends cheering him on.

Engages in friendly competition with McQueen, showing camaraderie and playful rivalry.

Flies past all the racers including Francesco, keeping pace with McQueen while using rockets.
